MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Abandon() cil managed

Docs.summary: Abandons the lock on a peek-locked message.
Docs.remarks: This operation should only be exercised on a message received in peek-lock mode.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the message is in the disposed state or the receiver with which the message was received is in disposed state.
Thrown when invoked on a message that has not been received from the message server or invoked on a message that has not been received in peek-lock mode.
Thrown when operation times out. The timeout period is initialized through the . You may need to increase the value of to avoid this exception if the timeout value is relatively low.
Thrown when the queue or subscription that receives the message is no longer present in the message server.
When service bus service is busy and is unable process the request.
When messaging entity the message was received from has been deleted.
When the lock associated with this message was lost or the lock token was not found.
When this message was received from a Session and the lock associated with the session was lost.
When the security token provided by the TokenProvider does not contain the claims to perform this operation.
When the number of concurrent connections to an entity exceed the maximum allowed value.

Docs.param: The key-value pair collection of properties to modify.

Thrown when the queue or subscription that the message was received from is no longer present in the message server.

Docs.summary: Asynchronously abandons the lock on a peek-locked message.
Docs.returns: The asynchronous result of the operation.

Docs.summary: Clones a message, so that it is possible to send a clone of a message as a new message.
Docs.returns: The that contains the cloned message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Complete() cil managed

Docs.summary: Completes the receive operation of a message and indicates that the message should be marked as processed and deleted.
Docs.remarks: This method is used as a handshake between the receiver and Service Bus for a guaranteed delivery of the message. If the receiver failed before calling this method, the message will be kept in the queue.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the message is in disposed state or the receiver with which the message was received is in disposed state.
Thrown when invoked on a message that has not been received from the message server or invoked on a message that has not been received in peek-lock mode.
Thrown when the queue or subscription that receives the message is no longer present in the message server.
Thrown when the operation times out. The timeout period is initialized through the . You may need to increase the value of to avoid this exception if the timeout value is relatively low.
Thrown if the lock on the message has expired. LockDuration is an entity-wide setting and can be initialized through and for queues and subscriptions respectively.

Thrown if the lock on the session has expired. The session lock duration is the same as the message LockDuration and is an entity-wide setting. It can be initialized through and for queues and subscriptions respectively.
When service bus service is busy and is unable process the request.
When messaging entity the message was received from has been deleted.
When the security token provided by the TokenProvider does not contain the claims to perform this operation.
When the number of concurrent connections to an entity exceed the maximum allowed value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CompleteAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: Asynchronously completes the receive operation of a message and indicates that the message should be marked as processed and deleted.
Docs.returns: The asynchronous result of the operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of the content.
Docs.value: The type of the content of the message body. This is a content type identifier utilized by the sender and receiver for application specific logic.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the correlation.
Docs.value: The identifier of the correlation.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.exception: Thrown when the message is in disposed state or the receiver with which the message was received is in disposed state.

Thrown when invoked on a message that has not been received from the message server or invoked on a message that has not been received in peek-lock mode.
Thrown when the queue or subscription that receives the message is no longer present in the message server.
Thrown when operation times out. Timeout period is initialized through the . You may need to increase the value of to avoid this exception if timeout value is relatively low.
Thrown if the lock on the message has expired. LockDuration is an entity-wide setting and can be initialized through and for Queues and Subscriptions respectively.

Thrown if the lock on the session has expired. Session lock duration is the same as message LockDuration and is an entity-wide setting. It can be initialized through and for Queues and Subscriptions respectively.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Defer() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for this message.
Docs.remarks: Before deferring the message, user MUST set aside the message receipt for later retrieval.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the message is in the disposed state or the receiver with which the message was received is in the disposed state.
Thrown when invoked on a message that has not been received from the message server or invoked on a message that has not been received in peek-lock mode.
Thrown when the queue or subscription that receives the message is no longer present in the message server.
Thrown when the operation times out. The timeout period is initialized through the . You may need to increase the value of to avoid this exception if the timeout value is relatively low.
Thrown if the lock on the message has expired. LockDuration is an entity-wide setting and can be initialized through and for queues and subscriptions respectively.

Thrown if the lock on the session has expired. The session lock duration is the same as the message LockDuration and is an entity-wide setting. It can be initialized through and for queues and subscriptions respectively.
When service bus service is busy and is unable process the request.
When messaging entity the message was received from has been deleted.
When the security token provided by the TokenProvider does not contain the claims to perform this operation.
When the number of concurrent connections to an entity exceed the maximum allowed value.

Docs.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the enqueued sequence number of the message.
Docs.value: The enqueued sequence number of the message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date and time of the sent time in UTC.
Docs.value: The enqueue time in UTC. This value represents the actual time of enqueuing the message.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC at which the message is set to expire.
Docs.value: The message expiration time in UTC.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.
If the message has not been delivered by ServerBus.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message is to be persisted to the database immediately, instead of being held in memory for a short time. This property is ignored if the message is sent to a non-express queue or topic.
Docs.value: true if the message is to be persisted to the database immediately, instead of being held in memory for a short time; otherwise, false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance !!T GetBody<T>() cil managed

Docs.typeparam: The type to which the message body will be deserialized.
Docs.summary: Deserializes the brokered message body into an object of the specified type by using the with a binary .
Docs.exception: If the message is in disposed state or the message body stream is already disposed.
If the message contains a null body stream or the body stream contains no data or the message body has already been consumed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance !!T GetBody<T>(class System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer serializer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Deserializes the BrokeredMessage body into an object of the specified type using DataContractSerializer with a Binary XmlObjectSerializer.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.
Thrown when invoked with a Null serializer object.
Thrown if the message contains a Null body stream, contains no data, or if the stream has been read once (through any GetBody() calls).

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the message has been consumed.
Docs.value: true if the message has been consumed; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the application specific label.

Thrown if the message was not received from the ServiceBus.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the message. This is a user-defined value that Service Bus can use to identify duplicate messages, if enabled.
Docs.value: The identifier of the message.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in a disposed state.
Thrown if the message identifier is null or exceeds 128 characters in length.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a partition key for sending a transactional message to a queue or topic that is not session-aware.
Docs.value: The partition key for sending a transactional message.

Docs.summary: Gets the application specific message properties.
Docs.value: The application specific message properties.
Docs.remarks: The size of each property object within the Properties bag cannot exceed 32 kilobytes. The collective size of the Properties bag cannot exceed 64 kilobytes.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Renews the lock on a message.
Docs.exception: If is true, you can retry the operation immediately.
You can retry the operation immediately.
Thrown if you have called too late. In a session, this is never thrown.
Thrown instead of if the message is from a .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address of the queue to reply to.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the session identifier to reply to.
Docs.value: The session identifier to reply to.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date and time in UTC at which the message will be enqueued. This property returns the time in UTC; when setting the property, the supplied DateTime value must also be in UTC.
Docs.value: The scheduled enqueue time in UTC. This value is for delayed message sending. It is utilized to delay messages sending to a specific time in the future.
Docs.remarks: Message enquing time does not mean that the message will be sent at the same time. It will get enqueued, but the actual sending time depends on the queue's workload and its state.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.
Thrown if the passed in value is DateTime.MaxValue.

Docs.summary: Gets the unique number assigned to a message by the Service Bus.
Docs.value: The unique number assigned to a message by the Service Bus.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.
Thrown if the message was not received from the message server.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the session.
Docs.value: The identifier of the session.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Gets the size of the message in bytes.
Docs.value: The message size in bytes.
Docs.remarks: The value of Size is only accurate after the BrokeredMessage instance is sent or received.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the state of the message.
Docs.value: The state of the message.

Docs.returns: An XmlSchema that describes the XML representation of the object that is produced by the WriteXml method and consumed by the ReadXml method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.WriteXml(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The XmlWriter stream to which the object is serialized.
Docs.summary: Converts an object into its XML representation. This method is reserved for internal use and should not be used directly or indirectly (e.g. using a serializer or a formatter).

Gets or sets the message’s time to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to the Service Bus. Messages older than their TimeToLive value will expire and no longer be retained in the message store. Subscribers will be unable to receive expired messages.TimeToLive is the maximum lifetime that a message can receive, but its value cannot exceed the entity specified the value on the destination queue or subscription. If a lower TimeToLive value is specified, it will be applied to the individual message. However, a larger value specified on the message will be overridden by the entity’s DefaultMessageTimeToLive value.
Docs.value: The message’s time to live value.
Docs.remarks: If the TTL set on a message by the sender exceeds the destination's TTL, then the message's TTL will be overwritten by the later one. See , and to learn more about how to control message TTL at an entity level.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.
Thrown if the passed in value is less than or equal to TimeSpan.Zero.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the send to address.
Docs.value: The send to address.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the message is in disposed state.

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the current message.
Docs.returns: The string representation of the current message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a partition key value when a transaction is to be used to send messages via a transfer queue.
Docs.value: The partition key value when a transaction is to be used to send messages via a transfer queue.
